The arrival area is busy and not very nice since there is so much cionstruction going on in front and around the hotel. The parling lot is ugly. needs painting, landscaping and better signage. The entrance to the hotel is at the moment VERY dangerous as there is construction and shutle busses everywhere trying to get in and out of the airport. If you are a tourist arriving in your rental car at night. It can be quite dangerous and confusing. The valet attendants are sometimes there, sometimes not. Do not expect 4 star service here, as valet at this hotel needs some training. I used it the first time and never again. The other times I self parked. The parking lot at this hotel is outdated and ungly. It also suffers from bad signage. It is also of an extremly non guest friendly design. As if you park on the 2nd level - you need to go to the end of tha parking lot to go in to the hotel, then go up a set of small stairs (No ramp or elevator) and then go thru a LONG and non air-conditioned corridor that runs almost the entire lenght of the hotel. Where finally you can go inside the doors that open up into the Mezzanine level. Where you can then take the elevators down to the lobby for registration. The rooms are very nice and if you get a corner room (The 02 line in particular) those are very spacious. But the ones in the middle are on the smaller side. The rooms are very ncie if you get a newley remodled room. If you dont, then the rooms look and feel like 1987 all over again, including vintage popcorn ceiling and vintage dark brown wood paneling on the doors. The bathrooms have only been "Refreshed" even in the newr rooms and could use a complete renovation. The tiles used to be white 15 years ago. Now they are yellow ish and have layers of scum and caucking that have been accunulated over the years... The countertops and vanity are new and very nice. With black granite and excellent lighting. The towels are also of good quality as are the amenitys provided. If you get a SPG room, they provide a nice assortment of upgraded amenitys in those rooms. Front desk agents smoke at the hotels entrance and it looks terrible. The agent that checked me in one night was smokig outside and he came inside to help me. He still smelled like smoke so bad that it made me sick. This should not be allowed. Shame on the managment here for not enforcing a non smoking policy with employees in front of guests. Lasllty. there is nowehere to eat withing walknig distance. They also do not offer 24 Hour room service. This is unacceptable in a major city like Miami, in a full service airport hotel. Lastly, they charge way to much for the food and so they take advantage of the sitaution. The breakfast buffet, for example, is $21 !!! I was at the Intercontinental Hotel in Tampa, FL 5 days ago and had a much better breakfast buffet and it was only $16. Overall the place has potential. But there is still a lot of work to be done. Stay here for the location, but not the property itself. At least not until they finish the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dawil41
Reviews.Content: This trip was very special to me, came down for my girlfriends birthday.the hotel was beautiful great service everyone was very nice at The front desk.food was great and I want to take the time to really thank ms.nicole carmenate for making mine and my girlfriends stay extra special.my next trip to miami I will definitely book my room with you guys again.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay and Geo Zeledon as great, wonderful guest service”
Reviews.Author: Bam1515
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our wonderful stay at the Sheraton. Check in process was quick and simple. Room was clean and comfortable (specially the pillows and comforter) But the one representative that truly made us feel at home, comfortable and welcome was Geo Zeledon. Geo was very helpful with providing us the instructions for parking, finding our room and mostly very hospitable to my mother that needed to take her medicine and he went above and beyond to get her her water. We also requested dinner recommendations and directions and he was very knowlegable of the area. A big Thank you to Geo Zeledon and to the Sheraton for such a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Personality and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: scarlettredd1
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel is the most unique, clean, organized, and spotless hotel I have been in quite some time. But not only that but you have 2 employees that have had a remarkable impression my sister and I. Starting with a front desk representative named Myriam Eugene. She was extremely sweet, helpful, and a very kind person to the point of going overboard to accommodate us. As well bartenders Christopher Agapay & Especially Miguel Gutierrez they offer the best selection of wine they had at the Hotel as well the food from the restaurant. They also make our stay at the bar so pleasant that we was just going to be there for about a half hour and left the bar after 3 hours . I myself Work in customer service for yrs now and it was a amazing trip for us!! Thank you so much for having such great and sweet employees.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on multiple levels”
Reviews.Author: ecoaggie
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we needed to arrange "bookend" nights in Miami for connections on each end of our international vacation. We chose the Sofitel for the front end and the Sheraton for the back. Both were similarly priced (although the Sofitel was $30 cheaper), close to the airport and have a free shuttle. The Sofitel won the comparison hands-down. Tthe facilities at the Sheraton were not quite as nice (generic lobby, cafeteria style restaurant, dingy beer-soaked sports bar, and musty room), but the major failing of the Sheraton was the poor customer service. Perhaps we should not have stayed during a time when the NBA finals were in progress, but nearly the entire staff was more interested in watching the game than helping customers. We waited for the shuttle for a considerably long-time and then things only got worse. Check-in lines were 8 people deep because only 1-2 people were assisting guests and 2-3 were watching the t.v. behind the counter. The bellhops/concierge staff were also lounging around watching the game with the exception of one individual. He helped us with our many bags and told me the restaurant was open until 10:15 (we had been traveling all day and arrived late, tired and hungry). We briefly settled into our so-called "Starwood Preferred Guest" room and then went downstairs for dinner. We arrived at 10pm and the restaurant staff told us they were closed. Disappointed, we walked back through the lobby and mentioned to the bellhop that previously helped us we thought the restaurant would still be open. He said it should be and went to mention it to someone behind the front desk who looked to be in charge. This person turned away from the t.v. to listen, shrugged his shoulders and told us to go eat in the bar then turned back to the television. Recognizing that the beer-soaked bar packed with basketball fans was no place for my 7-year old daughter we dejectedly returned upstairs. After hunger won over and realizing that this hotel does not have room service, I went back down, waited a very long time to be served and then carried a plate of nachos (there were only 4 items on the bar menu) back to our room. Overall this was a completely unacceptable experience for a respected chain like the Sheraton and we will think twice before staying at their properties elsewhere. We certainly won't return here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLER
Reviews.Content: I want to commend this location for excellence in service. Upon my arrival, I was disappointed with a few staff--Ernesto, Sissi and another young lady on the wait staff for the CPA Conference. As a guest, I was in the Mezzanine Lounge, where there was food prepared for hotel visitors for a conference. I wasn't there to eat the food, but rather to relax while completing some school work. As such, one of the gentleman asked if I was with them at the conference to which I replied no, and he simply asked if I had eaten, and again I replied, no. Well, he then offered me the opportunity to eat with the group and I capitulated for after their time of eating. I was approached by the wait staff and told not to eat the food that they were readily going to throw away. I was livid, and told them that I was invited to eat there, and I'm certain that the hotel staff wasn't suppose to be there eating for that matter. I was approached again later in the day, and just got frustrated with the predjudice. I am a gold member, and it was just out of place to be treated that way. However, I promised to write for 5 wonderful people who made my stay grand, and they are the most outstanding staff that any resort hotel could employ. They are Scott Goldberg, Allen Crawford(?) Anna--the morning Guest Lounge Host, Jennifer, the Concierge, and Chris the security. I would be remisiced if I failed to mention the young man who works the 2nd Shift--I want to call him, Addi, but that may be wrong--He has a dog, lives in Adventura and cares for the guests on a more personal matter. He came at the very beginning of his shift around 2pm-6pm to always make sure things were okay with me, and I appreciate that. I also believes he works at the Front Desk. He'll know who I'm speaking of. I think this is a great location. It is very clean, quite and quaint. It has the ambiance of luxury hotel, but the softness of affordability and family-friendly atmosphere. After I experienced the undue treatment from Ernesto--more than once, I was grateful that Scott, Anna, Allen, Chris, Jennifer and the other young man at the Front Desk went out of their way to make me--as the customer, feel warm, welcomed and treated me with the respect that I deserved and, not to mention, paid for. IT IS AN HONOR TO BE ABLE TO SERVE, BUT IT IS AN EVEN GREATER HONOR TO RECEIVE/HAVE GREAT OR EXCEPTIONAL AND OUTSTANDING SERVICE.(Let me know if you'd like to use that quote for an advertisement). Those six individuals provided that type of service. Thank you, and because of them, I'll remain a member and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Paz95
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good experience, great price it was a good stay:))) def coming back

Reviews.Title: “Pubic Hair in my bed”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: Mine was a business trip over 4 nights. The reviews here are by and large, positive. As a result, did not expect any hiccups. In hindsight, probably weighing up the comments, people tend to stay for 1 night and often, as distressed passengers via an airline. Check in was smooth and efficient. Allocated a queen sized room. The room was large and the bathroom ample. In terms of fittings, it's a concerete building that Sheraton have added their brand to. It does not bear any resemblance to a city location. In my mind, fitting with a much cheaper brand. My horror came when I noticed the sheets and pillow cases were not ironed. I pulled back the sheet to find pubic hairs. Clearly the maid service felt the last guest had stayed only a few hours and did not bother to change sheets. At the time I noticed this, it was beyond midnight and I was not in a position to call house keeping nor the front desk. The following morning I reported this to reception who appeared shocked but made a note of it. When I returned the same evening from my work, I could not guarantee they had been changed since they still did not look freshly ironed. My second gripe. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to/from the airport only. This is no different to any of the other airport hotels. A trip to the mall is $10 with set timings. Finally, food and beverage. $22 for a doble vodka?! Seriously ! Get over yourselves. I don't pay that at the Palmer House Hilton!!! Take a look at the cost of Smirnoff Red in a grocery store. Factor in your buying power, add a reasonable mark up, but $22?! The dinner buffet. One choice of meat. What does the pasta go with? Chicken What does the mashed potato go with? Chicken A la carte was expensive, but the food enjoyable. Breakfast : Are you kidding that you charge $3 for coffee and $4 for orange juice?!?! So : 2 eggs, 1 coffee and 1 juice = $19.00 + 15% service charge + tax = $23.56 So a family of 4 having the same breakfast, staying one night between flights would expect to pay $94.24 It's an airport hotel !!!!! I hired a car : Got to/from the malls and opened up a variety of restaurant choices in the vicinity and no doubt saved - if not necessarily in terms of $ then certainly in terms of freedom and choice. A friend came to visit me from Tampa. My friend, coming to visit a paying guest was expected to pay $18 parking. Despite contacting the front desk, this was the charge. Coming to visit a paying guest? Yep. If they stay an hour, yep - $18. I was not going to argue with the front desk, because English is my first language and I don't need someone repeating my question or responding to me like I'm an idiot. Would I recommend the hotel? If your airline is picking up the tab for 1 night - Sure. Be mindful of what lurks in your bed. If it's your choice and your $? There are other options. Would I use the Sheraton Group again? Absolutely. But not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Will try other Miami airport hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: StevoL
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for its convenient location during a layover en route to St. Kitts and used Starwood points for a free night. Convenience is about the only thing the hotel has going for it. The front desk staff was less than welcoming, looked bored, didn't smile. The room was a decent size with a nice view of the golf course and downtown Miami. Bathroom was on the small side. Was planning to catch a movie to kill some time during my layover, but after two calls to the front desk to report that the "menu" button on the remote wasn't responding, they said they'd send someone up to the room. About 15 minutes later, the guy didn't even need to enter the room.....he simply said that their entire system was down and wouldn't be working again for 2 days. I found a stray hair plastered on the shower wall, and then upon closer inspection, found one on the ceiling. The phone in the room was obviously not cleaned because it smelled from the last occupant's perfume. Bottom line is that the staff needs better guest service training and better supervisions of room cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service from Check-in to Check-out”
Reviews.Author: musiqtraveler
Reviews.Content: The establishment is very nice, convenient to the airport, and has great amenities. However I couldnt get past the rude front desk clerks and guest services staff. I'm not from Miami, so i'm not sure if this attitude was just indicative of the people in the city altogether, but everyone i encountered who worked at this hotel just had a permanent scowl attached to their face and when I asked a question they seemed as if it literally pained them to answer. They were quite short and rude. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a little too far from SoBe”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTravler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you're just in town for business or in between flights. The lobby features all the current departures and offers a free shuttle to the Airport. Our room was very spacious and the linens were nice and plush. They even let us check in early which was awesome. My only complaint is this is 5 minutes away from the airport, but 25 minutes from Miami Beach, without traffic... but there is usually always traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Stanley at the front desk for your excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: zavvydog
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, beautiful golf course, excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: ForrestnOdin
Reviews.Content: I did not intend to stay at this hotel but due to an airline error American Air put me up here for a night after losing my luggage and more or less destroying the last 2 days of my vacation to Dominica. When we arrived to the hotel the person working the desk, Jaholly (sorry if not spelled correctly), was incredibly friendly and kind....it was such a nice change from the condescending airline people that we had been dealing with all day. I don't know if she will ever see it but thanks Jaholly for being so nice! Also the boys working the bar deserve some recognition too...they were very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service: went over and beyond”
Reviews.Author: peoriaPeoria_IL
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night stay for 11 medical professionals who were travelling to the island of Haiti for a medical mission trip. The hotel management( Iriana & Oscar) worked with our church to establish a very reasonable rate. We booked 3 rooms and due to the early flight that we needed to catch the next day, the staff allowed us to set aside breakfast for the following morning. What great service!! It was very much appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Good Hotel, Very Happy, Can't Wait to Come Back”
Reviews.Author: MrTravelPlus
Reviews.Content: Recently, I spent a week at the Sheraton Miami Airport property. I am an SPG Platinum member, so I know my hotels. This property is very good, but the staff are amazing. The hotel rooms are renovated new, with plush heavenly beds, new carets, furniture, flat TVâ€™s, and more. The hotel has fast wireless internet, a good business centre, and free computer access. The VIP lounge is great, perhaps the high light of my trip. The room service is good! The hotel has a pool and gym. The main restaurant is good. The hotel is located within walking distance of the airport, but provides a free shuttle. I want to give special recognition to Scott Goldberg, an employee who has been working at this property since it opened in 1977. Scott really impressed me, he went way above and beyond to make our stay amazing. What I found really special is that he treats all guests as VIP, addressing them by name, giving them respect, making them all feel comfortable and at home, and tending to the needs of all guests on a 1 on 1 bases. He deserves an award. In our book, we give him the â€˜summa com laudeâ€™ award, latin for â€˜with highest praise and honourâ€™. Thank you Scott Goldberg, I can hardly wait to come again. You are the reason why I stay at SPG Properties, you are the reason why I am Platinum, You are the reason why I own stock in Starwood Preferred Guest Corporation. Respectfully, Dov Erlichman SPG Platinum

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Close to airport - and Several staff went above and beyond to help us!”
Reviews.Author: LoeFlyer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was convenient to return the rental car the night before our 7am flight and take the hotel shuttle in the morning. We will return because two staff members went out of their way to help make our stay more comfortable. Mr. Uriel Caro is a Housekeeping Manager who really knew the layout of the property, and made several recommendations of rooms that would be comfortable for us, staying just one (short) night with small children. We had arrived at 10pm with a week's worth of luggage and exhausted kids. Gustavo, one of the bellmen, was not only able to get our bags to the room quickly, but even led me back to the rental car facility in the hotel van and waited while I returned the car, giving me a ride that saved me from walking back. It's not a long walk (which is why we chose the hotel in the first place!) but it was late at night, I didn't know where I was going, and I had to be back at the airport in 6.5 hours. Both of these men went above and beyond to help out a tired traveler. They really made me feel like a guest!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Welcoming and Definitely Worth Re-Visiting”
Reviews.Author: BookLady30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two days in this lovely facility. The room was very large and luxurious. The bathroom and bedroom were spotless. Its location is not only convenient for the air traveller but fifteen minutes away by car from the city of Miami. After a day of touring, it was delightful to return to the hotel. We stayed on the club floor so the club room was accessible to us. It was a large beautiful room with a friendly and accommodating staff. My husband has a gluten allergy and both Anna R. and Scott G. could not do enough for him. They made special trips to the kitchen to find food that he could eat. We felt sorry to leave and will make a point of staying in this hotel again on our next visit to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average, Meeting Manager was AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: ahoward_siu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a conference and student competition. The hotel was average. A bit dated and worn. Noisy location next to the airport. However, I was responsible for organizing a full day compeititon utilizing the food service and PanAm ball rooms. Several hundred college students were in attendance and we required a very strict schedule. Ernesto (I unfortunetly don't have his last name) was AMAZING. He was a main contact at the hotel and bent over backwards to make sure we had everything we needed. He went above the call of duty in making sure every detail was taken care of. He was friendly and always upbeat. The event went off without a hitch in large part do to his cooperation. He is a true gem in the hotel managment industry. He deserves a raise.

Reviews.Title: “Not easy to get to by car but nicely updated hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdProMan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Miami Airport for a conference. It was not easy to get to the hotel by car but if coming via the airport it is a breeze, literally just across the street with round-the-clock shuttle service. Once I arrived at the hotel the valet service was outstanding. Since I had brought lots of materials for the conference, they were very helpful getting it all unloaded and delivered to the right places in the hotel. Thanks Giovanni. Inside, the hotel is nicely refurbished and the new furnishings and color schemes are very clean yet comfortable. The conference area is very nice. Every meeting room has sound, lighting control and AV controls built in. They only have one main ballroom but it was just the right size for our group. The guest rooms are a little tight but very comfortable. The desk in my room accommodated all the various devices I brought with enough power outlets for all. And lastly, this hotel is next to the airport but it seemed quiet and it backs up to a beautiful golf course so the pool overlooks the beautiful greens with a view of the Miami skyline beyond. We had a great experience at the Sheraton Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Actually at a walk-able distance!”
Reviews.Author: Verinagra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night. We landed in Miami around 8PM and had to leave for Houston on a 7.45 AM flight. It is an excellent location for travellers between two legs of flights. Room size is reasonable. There is free internet in rooms, complementary shuttle to airport and back, every fifteen minutes. We did not experience any noise, a common problem with airport hotels. Breakfast was included in the room charges but we could not take it as we had to leave before bâ€™fast time. Considering they are dealing with new people checking in and out constantly, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The dining room staff was a little uncooperative. We went for dinner at 9PM. We were offered both options buffet and â€˜a la carteâ€™. We had a vegetarian friend with us. He could not find any thing suitable on the menu, so said would go for the buffet. There was vegetarian soup, salad, rice and desert, but there was no vegetable entree. He requested if they could make an omelette for him. The head waiter said the kitchen was closed, so they couldnâ€™t. I wondered how he had offered an â€˜a la carteâ€™ meal in the first place? Buffet food was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: thorfl
Reviews.Content: I had been staying at this hotel quite a bit when it was The Wyndham. In January 2011 Sheraton took over. In March 2011 I stayed there and was disappointed in the changes I had experienced and one aspect of the service. I had contacted the General Manager of the hotel and expressed my displeasure. Upon my return in April I was quite surprised with the service and changes. It appeared he had taken my previous comments and had them corrected. My most recent experience was memorable and I will return to the facility. It is clean, has a very nice fitness center and the staff was very cordial. Two individual that stood out were Scotty who has worked at the hotel since it had opened many years ago and Charlotte (at the front desk).

Reviews.Title: “great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Toutpartout
Reviews.Content: use this hotel for businees travel quite a lot. Staff are very helpful, from the restaurant staff to the valet and concierge ( Geovanny Zeledon) , everyone goes the extra mile. The way back from the car park is not that well lit and I walked into a glass door face first on one stay. Like the monitor with all the flight departure times in the lobby . All in all, a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised by value and amenities. Great Staff...what a room”
Reviews.Author: stevenli9999
Reviews.Content: This former Wyndam didn't disappoint. Family trip this time. Great staff at checkin. This Sheraton has Club lounge and they are worth every penny. Being close to the airport, there's a lot of turnover traffic with day stays and cruisers, so the lobby can get busy at times. Being SPG members helps since they maintain the SPG Gold/Plat line specifically, unlike some other properties. The room was spetacular. The beds are better than 'heavenly'. Completely supportive with individual springs so the kid's movement didn't bother at all. Plush pillows abound (4 per bed!). We had a Pur room which had an air purifier in it. Wow. Very nice touch and appreciated from my allergy prone kids. Didn't hear a plane either. The sound proofing was done very nicely. Anyone in Miami can tell you the flight path goes right over the hotel....yet only time we heard a plane was walking outside. Pool: kept extra warm....a little bit too much, but the kids loved it. Good views of the golf course and peripheral canal--which had jumping fish no less to entertain the kids. Garage: a bit of a walk, but covered and goes to the messanine level, bypassing the lobby (nice touch). Park on the 2nd level to minimize steps (4 steps) on the luggage. The parking system is a bit of PITA as it kept losing the coding on the key to let us in/out. They are used to it and the valet attendent comes running down the ramp without 30sec to assist. Extras: WiFi: free. Nice touch for a Sheraton. Fast too. Complimentary water in SPG rooms. Again, the staff is superb and friendly. Access: Road construction stinks--thanks to Miami's 10+ year airport white elephant. Best way to get here is via douglas rd (NW 37th Ave). Avoid Le Jeune unless you want to add 10min to get here. Truely an enjoyable stay and pleasantly surprised for the Level 3 SPG hotel....this could easily be Level 4 with the service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Calina1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great location, conveniently close to the Airport. The Shuttle bus was great. We want to thanks specially Geo Zeledon! he referred us to great locations for food and places to visit, excellent prices, also helped us to get a car rental, he actually arranged himself a good price for us!. Front desk people were not too friendly as everyone else at the hotel. The room was clean and provided all the amenities, clean towel, shampoo, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: rlcruz_cedeno
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping did not replenish soaps, shampoos, conditioners etc. They also either threw away (or stole) a very expensive personal higiene product that was half full. When called to inform, it took over 1 hour to get someone to bring the items not replenished. I had to go down personally and talk with the Front Desk clerk after the 1st hour passed. On another note, and not the hotel's fault but getting to the hotel from the city is extremely confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: edexter
Reviews.Content: I returned from a business trip last week and went to the Sheraton Miami Airport Hotel garage to get my car. I use their parking facility anc shuttle when I fly from MIA. Had some trouble with my car. While explaining this situation at the front desk, Stan Pierre of the Guest Services department overheard me and offered to help. He exceeded my expectations. He exudes the spirit of hospitality. Needless to say I will continue to use this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: sfischburg
Reviews.Content: When clients are impressed, it makes my day! Bell staff were stand outs. They help to make this hotel exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: malcliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise after flying into Miami from the UK and at the end of our cruise we had a day room before our flight back. The thing that makes this hotel stand out, as others have said in these reviews, is the extremely comfortable beds â€“ probably the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in! We had a very pleasant view over the waterway to the Golf Course and during the day we had a relaxing time by the pool on the sunbeds, swimming and reading. The staff were very pleasant and we enjoyed breakfast and lunch during our two stays. There was also free internet access either on your laptop or on computers in the lobby which was great for catching up on emails before or after a cruise or for checking in online. The only negative point we found is that the bar by the swimming pool was closed when we spent the day at the hotel and the main bar was also closed so there was nowhere to buy a drink before lunch before going into the restaurant. There is a shuttle to and from the airport which only takes a few minutes and the driver was very helpful. Would recommend this hotel (and particularly its beds!) for a restful day either before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel- Saved our Sanity!!!”
Reviews.Author: GraceAdlerDesigns
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Miami after the fuel fire and thought we were going to have to sleep in the airport for two days. After exhausting all options and on a whim, I found my SPG card, called the Sheraton at 3 a.m. They booked rooms for that night and told us to take the next shuttle so we could at least rest in the clean lobby until the rooms were ready. When we arrived, they'd opened the rooms for us and we were able to get some much needed rest! I may be biased because, previously, we'd had two rooms at another subpar local "boutique hotel," but the beds were heavenly, the staff was great, The bar was our only dining option the next night and the staff seemed a little overwhelmed and service was spotty. However, the manager comped us a bottle of wine to make up for this. The main restaurant was ok, but we'd been eating hotel and airport food for a week, so we very sick of it. Also, loved the free Wi-Fi and the pretty pool with the Tiki Bar and large lounging area! The only critique I have is that some of the furniture and counter space was dusty- I think that we were put in rooms held for and leased by the airlines that are used infrequently. Overall, we had an absolutely positive experience with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We had a day room”
Reviews.Author: jennywrenSussex
Reviews.Content: We were given a day room voucher for this hotel as part of our cruise package. We were given a room on the 10th floor with a view over the golf course. The room was spacious and well appointed with coffee maker and excellent bathroom complete with toiletries. We had lunch in the restaurant which was pleasant and spent the afternoon on loungers around the pool. The hotel does run a shuttle to a shopping mall 8 miles away which would have been good but due to the lengthy process getting through US customs on leaving the ship we didn't have time to use it which was a pity. There are no shops near to the hotel at all. Free internet access in the lobby enables you to check in online and print your boarding pass. A free shuttle runs every 15 minutes to the airport which takes just 5 minutes so this hotel is an excellent choice for an overnight on arrival in Miami or as we had, a day room prior to an evening departure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and getting better with a super staff!”
Reviews.Author: JimRinggold_Georgia
Reviews.Content: This hotel started as a Sheraton property, but was, for the past ten or eleven years, a Wynham hotel. Sheraton is back in and the hotel is definitely up and coming. There are some major renovation plans on deck. But the staff is what makes this hotel. Scotty in the SPG Sky Lounge is awesome! He has been with the hotel for many years and is a wealth of helpful information and conversation about Miami. He is so helpful and friendly. GM Barger has a good team assembled and the convenience to the Airport and the Tri-Rail is perfect. This is definitely my hotel of choice when cruising out of Miami or Ft. Lauderdale, or heading to South America.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - this place almost ruined my vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cartmikk
Reviews.Content: Their service level is definitely on another level of TERRIBLE. This Sheraton did the unthinkable - they CANCELED my Starwood "friend discount" reservation and sold it to someone else (for money) and did not even notify me! I found this out only because my friend (the actual Starwood employee) wanted to double check the status of my reservation...2 DAYS BEFORE MY ACTUAL STAY. My friend was furious - this hotel is being written up with corporate as I speak. When I actually checked in, my friend who booked a 2nd room on her own almost lost HER room too because they lost HER reservation somehow! Then they said there was no proof of payment, and she had to dig through her bank statements just to prove that she did. But here's the real kicker: after all that drama was over, they charged THE WRONG PERSON'S CREDIT CARD when we checked out. They charged my Starwood employee friend's card instead of me. Then, when they tried to reverse the payment, they had to ask me for my credit card info again because they LOST the one that was supposed to be on their file. How can they have so many mistakes for one room in one weekend???! Unbelievable. This hotel seriously almost ruined the entire trip for me. Did I mention their location is horrible, cab service is very slow, and even the ATM machine was broken??? Please do us all a favor and do not stay here....staying at a trashy, run-down hut is better than staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: janine0802
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Miami for a music festival. We chose this hotel based on the reviews/price per night/overall value we anticipated getting. We really enjoyed our stay here! The manager, Tony, greeted us upon arrival and was very personable. We ate at the restaurant for lunch 2xs and had room service 2xs as well...good food. The room we had was on the "Club Floor", the top floor of the hotel. Worth the $10 difference per night from a standard room. Upgraded amenities, very comfortable bed, great view of golf course. Had Starbucks coffee you can make in the room. Everything was super clean. That floor allows access to a VIP-like room with free breakfast and evening time prepared food, snacks/beverages, pool table, and computers 24/7. Bottled water was free in the hotel room and in that Club Level room. I thought for Miami, this was great value for the money. Right next to Miami airport and has free shuttle that takes you to/from airport...then you can pay $2.50 for a shuttle that goes to the beaches all day. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nicole Carmenate is a superstar”
Reviews.Author: aa548098
Reviews.Content: This hotel has changed names in the last year. Once a Wyndham now a Sheraton. Many of the folks that made this a great stay close to the airport have stayed on and now work under the Sheraton Brand. Nicole Carmenate is one to those. Over the last month she has always been a smiling face ready to help anytime, not only for myself but all of the many travelers I have watched her take care of. Nicole along with many of her coworkers is the reason that I will continue to stay at this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in every dept.”
Reviews.Author: schmoov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the Sony Ericcson Tennis Tournament. Front desk staff went above and beyond to help me find info about accessing a shuttle to the stadium. Staff at the restaurant, especially Claudia (our waitress) provided consistently top notch service and hospitality. Very pleasant stay, made so by great people.

Reviews.Title: “A resort hotel disguised as an airport hotelâ€�”
Reviews.Author: joeb526
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel to meet a client who was flying in for the weekend from the North East. The hotel is literally on the door steps of the Miami Airport. I picked this hotel because it is conveniently located to Coral Gables which is so diverse in restaurants and night time entertainment. The hotel provided complimentary shuttle service to and from Coral Gables which was a huge convenience for us. I also wanted something right outside the airport that didnâ€™t feel like we were staying at the airport. The hotel has a great outside pool area over-looking a golf course, river and the skyline of Downtown Miami. The pool area has a tiki-bar with a heated pool that we took full advantage of. The staff also was very attentive to our needs including the execution of a beautiful amenity left in my clients room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, nothing nearby, whatch out for your stuff in the room”
Reviews.Author: traveler1007
Reviews.Content: It was overall a nice and clean hotel with comfy beds and ok food. But you should definitely watch out for your stuff in the room. I lost a ring that conveniently showed up in the most awkward place when I called to complain, and another co-worker lost a pair of shoes that never showed up. And the location is very close to the airport but nothing else whatsoever. No restaurants, pharmacy, etc. nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizabethmacdonald
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel 2-3 times a year when it was a Wydham and it was the best hotel. It just changed to a Sheraton and I hope during the switchover they kept the same staff, the same customer service levels, the same ambience and the same beds/rooms. The valet and bell staff here were the best (extremely friendly, professional, helpful, efficient) and what impressed me the most was that even though I stayed here only 1-3 times a year some of them would remember my name from year-to-year. Great staff can make or break a hotel and these staff set the bar high. The beds were super comfortable and clean and the food in the restaurant was really good. This hotel was so good (as a Wyndham) that I once had business on Miami Beach during spring break and didn't want to deal with the spring break crowd and party atmosphere that instead I stayed at the Wyndham Airport Hotel and commuted each day instead just so I was guaranteed a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, dirty, and outdated”
Reviews.Author: darrena77
Reviews.Content: How does this place have 3-1/2 stars? There was no soap in our room, 1/2 a roll of toilet paper with no extra rolls and too many hairs in the bath tub to count.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but poor after sales”
Reviews.Author: ChrisF83
Reviews.Content: I held a conference at this hotel where we had 50 attendees. The rooms were nice and clean if a little basic. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout. After the event the service was very bad. I have been trying to get i contact about missing Starwood points for spending thousands of dollars at this hotel and I have had no response despite a number of reminders with false promises of 'looking into it'. I have complained but had no repsponse!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I have ever splept in!”
Reviews.Author: TheMissingLink66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the above hotel the night before I joined a cruise ship. There was a courtesy bus from the aiprort straight to the doors. The reception staff (especially Miryam) were fantastic. The rooms roomy with all the amenities you would require. The bed was out of this world! SO SO comfortable (when i mentioned this to the reception staff they informed me I could buy it from the Sheraton on line shop - what a great idea!) We had dinner and breakfast there (both buffets) and had use of the pool an sun chairs. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone stopping off in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “So outdated”
Reviews.Author: TraceyK66
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for an outdated hotel. I wish I had paid more and stayed somewhere more pleasant, the staff couldn't even cope with merging two bookings for consecutive nights! Nightmare to get in and out of if you are driving, avoid it if you can

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrible bar service”
Reviews.Author: mcarter68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to a 6am flight and they have 24 hr shuttle service. Check-in was a little slow as there was a large group ahead of me, but I was pretty happy when they upgraded me to the club level due to SPG Gold status. Rooms on the Club floor are pretty comfy. There are no nearby restaurants but the bar is open and serving food until midnight, so I stopped in for a bite to eat. I sat at the bar, which was about half occupied, and waited 15 minutes for the bartender to acknowledge me. I ordered a drink and a club sandwich. 35 minutes later the sandwich was nowhere to be seen and the bartender had disappeared. Meanwhile two guys next to me sat down, ordered wings and were half way through eating them. Finally got a lukewarm sandwich and cold soggy fries after 40 or so minutes. No apology or anything. Just a guest check with 15% gratuity added on. If you stay here, eat dinner before you arrive! Bottom line is this place is ok if you need a place near the airport but nothing special and there are much better places for less money.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal airport hotel, popular with aircrew”
Reviews.Author: johnbursby
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night en route from Lima lo Heathrow. I found the Sheraton Airport Miami to be one of the few airport hotels anywhere with both character and a regular clientele. Due to my own oversight I had booked the wrong night. However the staff at reception were just superb...particularly Miriam (Manager please note) and a room was soon sorted out. The bar had a friendly atmosphere probably due to the many regulars. My meal in the restaurant was delicious. All in all a very good stay, but the hotel (like me) is starting to show its age and perhaps the Sheraton bean counters could make provision for a make over in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Professionals”
Reviews.Author: Makes_Me_Wonder
Reviews.Content: I work for a fairly large international organization and we recently held a 10 day workshop at the Sheraton Miami Airport Hotel. It was virtually headache free! Staff knew what they were doing, anticipated our needs, made valuable suggestions and were very accommodating in every way possible. I've been to many venues with conference facilities in Europe, Latin America and North America but not every venue has business event coordinator experts. There is a difference between handling a wedding or a retreat that lasts just one day and handling a business meeting that can last over a week. The Sheraton Miami knows how to efficiently help you run your business meeting no matter what the size of your group. Its location is ideal for business travellers. Right there at the airport and less than 20 minutes from Miami Beach if you want a change of atmosphere. Besides, once you are in the hotel, you forget how close you are to the air traffic. The rooms are very comfortable and the food is good. Breakfast is pretty much standard but the staff makes all the difference. Wireless service on the entire hotel property is a plus. So in the end, for the purposes of our 10 day workshop, the hotel was perfect. P.S. All the car rental agencies are right across the hotel! If youâ€™re staying for a while, be sure to rent a car with a GPS to get around Miami. Oh, and you can walk to the car rental place. No need to take the hotel shuttle to the airport only to get on the car rental shuttle at the airport to return to a building thatâ€™s right across from the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Patrickk92
Reviews.Content: Hello folks, I had the opportunity to stay an extra day in Miami and a few of us decided to stay at the Sheraton Miami Airport Hotel & Executive Meeting Center and boy the stay was much appreciated and needed. Our room such a great view over the golf course on the pool side. From the shuttle (shuttle drivers Jeff), the front desk and the restaurant (Frank & Domingo) just pure AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, First Class Facilities, and Outstanding Service-oriented Staff”
Reviews.Author: spgplatinumchicago
Reviews.Content: As a long-time Starwood Platinum member, I have had the opportunity to stay at many properties. This was my first visit to this hotel, and I plan to become a regular here. Of primary importance is the staff, ALL of whom, from the General Manager on down, provided excellent and caring service throughout my stay. I was treated as if I were 'family'. Special thanks should be given to Lucas, Sirle, Stanley, Lorraine, Sarah, all of whom were wonderful to work with. Compliments to Raul (the hotel manager) for his generous assistance. The hotel facilities are first class. I was given a beautiful suite which far exceeded my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the rooms are, considering the proximity to Miami airport - never heard planes landing/taking off. The pool area and fitness center are inviting and are much more than adequate to satisfy my needs. The hotel's public areas are nicely designed and quite pleasant. There is a club lounge which provides breakfast and evening snacks. The evening selection is one of the best I have come accross. Thanks to Chef Frank for providing an interesting array of choices. Finally, the hotel's location provides easy access to the Miami area and beyond. I look forward to many more stays.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad, but not worth any significant amount of money”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel after flying into Fort Lauderdale, not MIA, because this hotel had an incredible deal for SPG points. That being said, when I rate, I try to take into account what I would have paid for the room. First of all, the hotel is convenient only to MIA airport. If you are coming from somewhere else, you better have a good GPS handy, because access is rather tricky, especially when coming from the west. I felt it was a bit chintzy to charge $20 for parking in an area where parking is very much not at a premium. No big deal, though. The greeting a reception were nice. I felt my room was perfectly nice looking, unlike a number of other reviewers. Perhaps as an SPG gold member I got a refurbished room? Everything was clean, spacious, and in working order, except the TV checkout at the end of the stay. My main complaints were: (1) The rooms were not insulated sufficiently for an airport hotel under a flight path. There was more airport noise than most airport hotels I've stayed in (which is quite a few). (2) We ordered room service breakfast which never came. We weren't charged for it, and just ended up eating out, but how difficult is it to get that right? (3) Pool area was small and claustrophobic. So for the small number of SPG points I was charged, I can't complain, but for the price they want to charge, I feel one should probably be able to do a lot better, especially if one needs to park. This is, after all, just a 3* airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Vanilla airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here on arrival at Miami Airport because I wasn't sure if my flight was going to be delayed etc. There is a shuttle from the terminal which goes every 15mins. I had to wait about 7min, the journey is maybe 2-3min so very close. Check-in was quick & easy. Lobby is OK, staff were helpful. Room was clean, nothing fancy but no surprises there. Internet was free which is good. Restaurant was OK - staff were friendly, food was surprisingly good. Looks like the hotel is used quite a bit by air crew because there were some checking in when I arrived and there is a large bar with pool table etc to hang out in.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: pbmcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention and I was horrified to wake up with bed bug bites all over my legs- had to go to the emergency room which they said they would pay for the visit and then no one would return my phone calls after I sent them the bill. DO NOT STAY HERE! Would have seemed to be clean but bed bugs in the beds!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ari100
Reviews.Content: This hotel, former Wyndham and before that already a Sheraton, is an aberration! I don't understand why Sheraton bought it and put its brand on it. It looks sad and it is the worst place where to spend even one night before or after your flight. They just bought it, waited some time and opened it again publicizing a radical renovation that never happened. I am starwood gold member (and have been a gold member for the past 4 years) and after this experience I started doubting of the commitment of this brand to quality and decent accommodation. Please, close it as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than what I would expect from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Sheraton (former Wyndham) before an early flight. I had my doubts as we pulled up outside the hotel. When walking in to the lobby it did however look very nice. We were the only ones in the lobby, the front desk staff did however still spend more time talking to each other than helping us to check-in quickly. Coming up to the floor we were at the 'fresh' and new feel from the lobby was all gone. The corridors were long, dirty carpets and the roof was very low giving it a very cramped feel. The sign with the room number outside our room had also been replaced with a piece of paper with the room number on. The room was probably modern some time during the 90s but now it felt in desperate need of refurbishment. It had more the feel of like a Motel8 or something like that than the Sheraton. All the necessary things were however there (such as TV, coffee maker, desk, chairs, iron etc) so it was functional. The best thing about the room was the bed, it was comfortable and big. Other good things about the hotel was the shuttle bus (running every 15 minutes) and the location close to the airport was also good. Still there are other better options for airport hotels (for example the Best Western I stayed at a few weeks earlier).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Front Desk and BellStand Customer Service Of any hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: global_tx
Reviews.Content: Sheraton (the old Wyndham) has upgraded and installed heavenly beds in all rooms -they are fantastic. Thats the good news , and there isn't much more. The front desk could care less about your stay. They don't answer the phones. They don't follow up on issues. Hotel has a great meetings team but the other service is so bad here It isnt worth the effort. The meetings staff was excellent, as was the restaurant staff (Diego) and Michael (?) in the bar. Major customer service training is needed here - only a handful of employees should be in contact with a customer.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Akkat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton, and proceeded to sit in the lobby for nearly 2 hours while the front desk tried to figure out our reservations. The hotel insisted that we had not made reservations for 3 days, but only 1, even though my companions had their reservation confirmations in had. They argued and tried to send us away, saying that it was not their fault. Luckily, they could see that my mother wasn't going to back down, and finally found a way to honor the reservation. The hotel and the rooms are nice enough, I suppose. My husband and I had to catch a plane the next morning, so we pre-ordered breakfast, set our alarms, and thought all was well. When we got up to take showers, before our cross-country flight from Miami to Alaska, there was NO HOT WATER! I would never have guessed that a hotel that size could be out of hot water at 4 AM. We tried again later, with the same results. Then our breakfast never showed up. We tried repeatedly to contact room service and never got an answer. Five minutes before we left for the airport, the kitchen called to ask if we still wanted our breakfast, saying they had just gotten the order we put in the night before. So our flights were a little rough, to say the least, having had no shower or breakfast. All in all, VERY DISAPPOINTING SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: janais2000
Reviews.Content: The first plus for me for this hotel is its proximity to the airport which is really convenient. The Hotel provides an airport shuttle which runs every 15 minutes and you commute easily between the airport and the hotel in less than 5 minutes. I found all the staff to be friendly and helpful, and the front desk staff is quite professional. The rooms are pretty nice and on my last stay there I had a very pretty view of the golf course. I did not use many of the facilities including the pool, but did have a stroll around the pool area which is quite attractive and seems very relaxing. The buffet breakfast is pretty good, though a bit pricey, and the restaurant staff very friendly. Also convenient is the fact that the Dolphin Mall Shuttle makes a stop at this hotel, so for those interested in shopping, that's an added feature. I am told that the hotel recently changed hands, and they obviously kept some of the fixtures from the previous ownership, but I do hope that they will address this in the short term, as things like the stained carpets in the hallways are a bit of a turnoff and detract from the overall aesthetics of the hotel. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicanyardie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally 3 minutes away from the terminals unlike many so called airport hotels in Miami. The staff is quite helpful, professional and friendly. Check in was very easy and quite fast. The rooms are quite nice and the price includes wireless internet which is useful. Only ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was expensive - you are best taking the buffet since the individual items add up quickly. Buffet Breakfast for 2 people cost $44.00 which is a bit ridiculous. The service however is very attentive and the staff very friendly. Stayed there twice in two weeks and was on two different floors. The second time we noticed that the entire length of the hall corridor was soiled and should have been replaced so we were apprehensive about the room but it was fine inside. Another bonus is that there is a regular shuttle which does run on time. The Dolphin Mall shuttle also stops at the hotel. I did not use the fitness centre but visited it and it is very well equipped with many machines, weights etc.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing worse than the food was the service”
Reviews.Author: jtsttr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night to catch an early flight. The lobby is very nice. It makes you think you're not in a cheap airport hotel. Don't let that fool you - you are. There was trash in the hallways when we got there, still there the next morning. The bar smelled like dirty dishwater. Dinner service was terrible. The waiter forgot to bring my drink and never refilled our empty water glasses. The food was absolutely terrible. Only stay here if you must, and don't eat.
